description.narrative: 1. Access to Microfinance by expanding the outreach of Equitas in several of the poorer states in India, where the Company would scale up in the next few years. 2. Promoting a more balanced growth of microfinance by supporting an institution that has been a front-runner in adopting technology, is amongst the pioneers in best practices on responsible financing, takes a very active part in sector development and is working to provide varied financial services to customer segments which have limited access to formal sources of finance.

The proposed project envisages a senior debt investment in Equitas Micro Finance Private Limited (Equitas Micro Finance or the Company), which is a leading Microfinance Institution (MFI) in India. Equitas Micro Finance has a borrower base of 1.3 million across 5 states and 1 union territory including the Low Income States of Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh with a loan portfolio of US$215 million equivalent Equitas Micro Finance is widely acknowledged for following best practices in responsible financing and corporate governance. Equitas Micro Finance also has a strong focus on using technology and process innovation to increase operational efficiency through implementation of a scalable system for IT infrastructure. The proposed investment would manifest IFCs support for an existing portfolio investee and would be amongst the first few ECB transactions in the microfinance space and is particularly important as a source of long tenor funding.
